quizSynopsis: This quiz tests your knowledge of object-oriented programming concepts.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of object-oriented programming (OOP)?
answers: To create modular and maintainable software
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! The primary goal of OOP is to create modular and maintainable software.
questions.explanation: OOP emphasizes organizing code into reusable and understandable objects, leading to more maintainable software.

questions.question: Which of the following are fundamental principles of OOP? (Select all that apply)
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Inheritance, Encapsulation, and Polymorphism are fundamental principles of OOP.
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows the creation of new classes based on existing ones, Encapsulation hides the internal details of objects, and Polymorphism enables objects to take on multiple forms.

questions.question: What is the concept of inheritance in OOP?
answers: The ability to create objects from classes
The process of one class inheriting properties and behaviors from another
A method for combining data from multiple objects
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! Inheritance is the process of one class inheriting properties and behaviors from another.
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows for code reuse and the creation of new classes based on existing ones.

questions.question: What is polymorphism in OOP?
answers: The ability of an object to take on multiple forms
The process of hiding internal implementation details
The practice of combining objects into a single class
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! Polymorphism is the ability of an object to take on multiple forms.
questions.explanation: Polymorphism allows different objects to respond to the same method or message in a way that is specific to their individual class.
